text: so you guys know how much I love reading
stuff right well today I'm upping the
ante and I'm reading my chicken cutlets
with a parmesan parsley crust it's super
delicious and very very easy start off
by making some bread crumbs this is just
plain white sandwich bread
I love the fresh breadcrumbs on this
recipe but you could use panko if you
want it to the regular dry would
probably be just a little bit too fine
so just tear them into pieces and put
them into a food processor along with a
half a cup of grated Parmesan cheese and
the quarter teaspoon each of salt coarse
salt and pepper
you also want about two tablespoons of
chopped fresh parsley
I usually just shave the parsley off the
stem I don't worry if there's a little
bit of stem left on there and then chop
it up make sure that it's very dry so a
salad spinner is a great way to dry
herbs parsley can go into the food
processor and then just grind everything
up until you get bread crumbs I like to
get them pretty fine so that they stick
nice and evenly and really coat the
chicken breast so don't let them stay
too coarse and then in this other pie
plate I have one large egg she's gonna
help the breadcrumbs stick to the
chicken you may find that you need more
than one but since I'm starting with
only four chicken cutlets I think that
one egg will be fine so here I have four
chicken cutlets these are about four to
six ounces apiece and then coat your
chicken in the egg and then in the
breadcrumbs when they're nice and coated
you can put them back on the tray I feel
like I'm going to have extra bread
crumbs which means I'm going to coat
some extra cutlets so that I can have
them in the freezer as a happy day when
you come home there's pre coated chicken
cutlets in the freezer that you can cook
up mmm I like to turn them once or twice
and really Pat the bread crumbs on to
the chicken cutlets so that it's really
fully coated now all that's left to do
is cook them which shouldn't take very
long at all it's only about five minutes
in the pan over here I have a nonstick
skillet to that add some oil I'm using
olive oil let it get nice and hot before
you add your cutlet carefully put your
cutlets into the pan if it's sizzles
that's a good time probably will take
about two to three minutes per side for
these to get nice and golden brown and
cooked through make sure that the pan is
a nonstick pan because the cheese and
the coating will really stick to a
regular pan if you're not careful I
think these are golden on the first side
turn them over oh gosh the other thing
about the Parmesan cheese
aside from deliciousness factor is that
it gets everything extra golden brown
which is really really nice okay I'm
gonna make a little pan sauce so I'm
gonna take them out and just put them on
some paper towels to drain while I do
that pretty right golden brown sizzle II
salty oh yeah I'm excited
I'm definitely making more of these by
the way like I said I'm gonna put some
in the freezer so wipe out your pan
because there's some crumbs in here and
stuff that you don't need now you can
make this quarter cup of water couple
tablespoons of lemon juice you can use
chicken broth instead of water if you
wanted to certainly would have more
flavor let it simmer up and then a
tablespoon of Dijon mustard you could
use grainy mustard if you wanted to you
don't want to cook it too long because
it'll all evaporate away so turn the
heat off and then add two tablespoons of
butter you can add it in a couple pieces
and then just swirl it in if your pan
gets too cool which I don't think it
will but if it does get too cool being
not on the heat you can always turn the
lid back on
voila up hands spoon a little bit of

just the right balance in the sauce a
